worklogs.comment:
mrkn commented on pull request #5166: WIP: ARROW-5830: [C++] Stop using memcmp in TensorEquals for tensors with float values
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5166
 
 
   **NOTE: This pull-request depends on #5160**
   
   `memcmp` is an inappropriate way to examine the equality of tensors with float values because they can have NaNs.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

mrkn commented on issue #5166: ARROW-5830: [C++] Stop using memcmp in TensorEquals for tensors with float values
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5166#issuecomment-524931007
 
 
   @wesm I noticed that `TensorEquals` should also have an optional parameter of `EqualOptions`.
   I want to make a change to add it by this Wednesday, please wait a moment.
   
   And I'll look at ARROW-6359.  Thank you for telling me.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Because memcmp problematic for comparing floating-point values, such as NaNs.
